column4: hi there: got a problem on mounting an nfs partition on boot. the fstab file works [proof giving mount -a], but on boot it doesn't want to work. Any idea?!
can you check your syslog and look for errors?
I think I have similar issues with other services
by default you are not allowed to connect to nfs mounts as root (as that would give the client "full" access on the export)
did you run mount -a as a regular user or as root?
nosquashroot should fix that
check your syslogs (on both servers) .... it will probably give some indication
can you paste your /etc/exports somewhere ?
together with the ips of both boxes and the /etc/fstab
it's been several years since I worked with nfs and there were some snags, but overall it was quite straight forward
it is on the nfs server
btw http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/454944/
and, yes, the twos are allowed to access the nfs share :)

it's not a linux/unix box?
were you running "mount -a" as a regular user or as root?
have you checked syslog for errors?
